name: So Many Souls
description:
The first new studio album in two years released on the 16th October. This is your chance to pre-order the new album 'So Many Souls' which includes the singles 'We Are Machines' and 'Promises' which have been blowing away audiences so far this year. 

Featuring 10 tracks showcasing OST brand of post-dance, this album is the collection of a years work, and the time spent on this shows. The songwriting and execution take OST to their most incisive. Explosive beats, phat drops and sing along choruses all show the refined direction and quality of OST's music.

Track list:
1) Promises
2) Wasteland
3) We Are Machines
4) So Many Souls
5) Sunsets and Silence
6) Across The Skyline
7) How Were We Supposed To Know
8) Always
9) Gods Electric Super Scene 
10) Opportunities

It's been a long time coming but OST have stepped it up a gear on this album.

name: The Live Sessions
description:
The new album from OST, which the majority of was recorded live in one sleepless night in a small little studio in Brumtown. There were no edits, the sound of this CD is just OST rocking out in a basement. And it sounds fantastic. There are 6 studio tracks and 3 live tracks from their energetic and destructive live sets. This recording allows you to hear the live sound in CD format and shows OST at their most direct.

Track Listing:
1) Opportunities
2) Across the Skyline
3) We Are Machines
4) Always
5) Everything Makes Sense
6) Fireflies

Bonus Tracks

7) The Preacher Part II
8) God's Electric Super Scene
9) Blindfolds

name: Mystery Sound Playground
description: The new album from OST released on the 20th September, featuring vocals for the very first time. An album which sees a maturer contemplative sound. An album full of stories. Tales of journeys made in the old world. Tales of coincidences and lost chances. Combining heavy beats with euphoric melodies and ryhthms, OST have a new determination in their step to challenge stagnation. Have a listen for yourself at www.myspace.com/oldschooltie

name: You Borrow From Tomorrow
description: The New EP from OST… described as ‘f*g wicked by BBC Swindon’ and a review of lead track Nuclear Child was summed up in the following words ‘their style can go from understated genius to mesmerising soundscapes in a heartbeat.’ by demos reviewed.
